citation.article-title: Vitellibacter vladivostokensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a new member of the phylum Cytophaga-Flavobacterium-Bacteroides
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Vitellibacter (Vi.tel.li.bac′ter. L. n. vitellus egg yolk; N.L. masc. n. bacter rod; N.L. masc. n. Vitellibacter egg-yolk-coloured rod).
Rod-shaped cells, not flagellated, no gliding motility.
Cytochrome oxidase-, catalase- and alkaline phosphatase-positive.
The major respiratory quinone is MK-6.
The main cellular fatty acids are branched-chain saturated fatty acids i15 : 0 and α15 : 0.
As determined by 16S rDNA sequence analysis, the genus Vitellibacter is a member of the Cytophaga–Flavobacterium–Bacteroides phylum, family Flavobacteriaceae.
The type species is Vitellibacter vladivostokensis.
